instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> low
threads.message:
Hi there,

I  got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a liquid damage around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. I'm in S0 State but <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWGD</SIGNAL> is missing because of low <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>.
Already replaced <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> and C/R/<TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>. Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> seems good (320 Omh).
Here are the voltages of <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>:
Pin 06 :1.8V
Pin 12: 5.1V
Pin 16: 3.3V
Pin 17: 0.0V
Already checked all traces and solders around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>... they seem to be ok.

Any ideas what else could be the problem here?
Thanks and best regards
Dudi

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> low
threads.message: Forgot to mention: <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> is currently at 0.34V
